column4: what's the easiest way to rip an mp3 with a stock install of breezy?
lame's not available, to build it i need to first install a bunch of build tools.  toolame is available -- how do i use it with sound juicer?
if you fire up synaptic and search for lame, it should come up, iirc. so there is no need to compile it from source.
did you remember to add the universe and multiverse repositories?
i've added universe, i didn't add multiverse.  is it in there?  i'll check...
yes, its in multiverse (i just checked) :)
i've just checked, i had already enabled multiverse (and i'm still not seeing it ??)...
the only repository still commented out in sources.list is "breezy-security universe"
when i search in my synaptic for lame, by name, lame comes up. so i do not know what's up. did you try "reload" to refresh package list?
it's updating every time i click "reload"...  is that correct?
when I search by name for "lame" i get [flamethrower, glame, systemimager-server-flamethr, toolame]
nope.  let me see if it's on the cd...
if you go to settings -> repositories in synaptic, does it list multiverse, under breezy badger (binary) ?
i have "http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu breezy-backports (Binary) main restricted universe multiverse"
that's what i have too. i can't think why you are having problems...

sorry i couldnt be of more useful assistance. :| but at any rate, even if you cant get at it from repository, you could find the binary .deb package for ubuntu and install it using dpkg, rather than compiling source.
